docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: In a case being watched around the country, the city will argue in court this week that mentally retarded adults who live at home are entitled to the same services the state gives retarded adults in institutions or who live apart from their families.

headline.main: Suit Over Care for Retarded May Bring Wider Challenges

byline.original: By MICHAEL deCOURCY HINDS, Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: As millions of summer-sated children in the New York metropolitan region get ready to tackle the 3 R's, school officials are tackling a tough course in demographics: how to cope with the baby-boom generation's own baby boom, which has led to overcrowded elementary schools, while high school classes have shrunk dramatically.

headline.main: As School Begins, Educators Are Facing Tough Lessons
